title: Insights
subtitle: Stories and insights from Thai students studying in Korea
introduction: Read about the experiences of Thai students who have studied or are currently studying in South Korea. Learn about their journey, challenges, and advice for prospective students.

experiences.name: Nunnalin Heimvichit
experiences.shortBio: Currently pursuing Bachelor's in Computer Science at Ewha with focus on Machine Learning. Currently pursuing Bachelor's in Computer Science at Ewha with focus on Machine Learning. Currently pursuing Bachelor's in Computer Science at Ewha with focus on Machine Learning.
experiences.whyKorea: I chose South Korea because of its advanced technology sector and the opportunity to learn from world-class researchers. The scholarship opportunities were also a major factor. Korea's tech industry is booming, and being here gives me direct access to companies like Samsung, LG, and numerous startups.
experiences.whyMajor: Computer Science has always been my passion since high school. I wanted to specialize in AI because I believe it will shape the future. SNU's CS department has excellent faculty members who are leaders in machine learning research.
majorCons: Can be stressful during thesis period
experiences.lifeInKorea: Life in Korea has been an incredible journey. The public transportation is amazing, and Seoul has everything you need. Korean food took some getting used to, but now I love it. The four seasons are beautiful, though winter can be quite cold. I've made friends from all over the world and have traveled to many places in Korea.
experiences.recommendations: For those interested in CS at Ewha: 1) Start learning Korean basics before coming, 2) Prepare a strong SOP highlighting your passion for CS, 3) Engage in coding projects or competitions to build your skills, 4) Network with current students or alumni for insights.
